intro: Galium melanantherum, commonly known as black-flowered bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in cymes, and it has opposite, simple leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. Galium melanantherum thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
